original_title: Iraq is facing a water crisis, hit by one of its worst droughts in century | Drought News | Al Jazeera
article_summary: Iraq is experiencing its worst drought in nearly a century, causing a humanitarian crisis in Basra, a vital port city. The Tigris and Euphrates Rivers, which flow into the Persian Gulf, have seen their levels drop due to poor rainfall and upstream water restrictions. Many residents are forced to travel long distances for clean water and face health issues due to polluted seawater and rising salinity levels. Experts warn that the water crisis will worsen without urgent government action.</s>
